TypeSignature.Value: public class CursorWindow : Android.Database.Sqlite.SQLiteClosable, Android.OS.IParcelable, IDisposable

.class public auto ansi beforefieldinit CursorWindow extends Android.Database.Sqlite.SQLiteClosable implements class Android.OS.IParcelable, class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: A buffer containing multiple cursor rows.

remarks.para: A buffer containing multiple cursor rows.

A is read-write when initially created and used locally. When sent to a remote process (by writing it to a ), the remote process receives a read-only view of the cursor window. Typically the cursor window will be allocated by the producer, filled with data, and then sent to the consumer for reading.

Docs.summary: Creates a new empty cursor window.

remarks.para: Creates a new empty cursor window.
The cursor initially has no rows or columns. Call to set the number of columns before adding any rows to the cursor.

Docs.summary: Clears out the existing contents of the window, making it safe to reuse for new data.

remarks.para: Clears out the existing contents of the window, making it safe to reuse for new data.
The start position (), number of rows (), and number of columns in the cursor are all reset to zero.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void CopyStringToBuffer (int row, int column, Android.Database.CharArrayBuffer buffer);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CopyStringToBuffer(int32 row, int32 column, class Android.Database.CharArrayBuffer buffer) cil managed

Docs.param: The to hold the string. It is automatically resized if the requested string is larger than the buffer's current capacity.
Docs.summary: Copies the text of the field at the specified row and column index into a .

remarks.para: Copies the text of the field at the specified row and column index into a .

The buffer is populated as follows:
If the buffer is too small for the value to be copied, then it is automatically resized.
If the field is of type , then the buffer is set to an empty string.
If the field is of type , then the buffer is set to the contents of the string.
If the field is of type , then the buffer is set to a string representation of the integer in decimal, obtained by formatting the value with the printf family of functions using format specifier %lld.
If the field is of type , then the buffer is set to a string representation of the floating-point value in decimal, obtained by formatting the value with the printf family of functions using format specifier %g.
If the field is of type , then a is thrown.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual byte[] GetBlob (int row, int column);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance unsigned int8[] GetBlob(int32 row, int32 column) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the field at the specified row and column index as a byte array.

remarks.para: Gets the value of the field at the specified row and column index as a byte array.

The result is determined as follows:
If the field is of type , then the result is null.
If the field is of type , then the result is the blob value.
If the field is of type , then the result is the array of bytes that make up the internal representation of the string value.
If the field is of type or , then a is thrown.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual double GetDouble (int row, int column);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance float64 GetDouble(int32 row, int32 column) cil managed

Docs.summary: Gets the value of the field at the specified row and column index as a double.

remarks.para: Gets the value of the field at the specified row and column index as a double.

The result is determined as follows:
If the field is of type , then the result is 0.0.
If the field is of type , then the result is the value obtained by parsing the string value with strtod.
If the field is of type , then the result is the integer value converted to a double.
If the field is of type , then the result is the double value.
If the field is of type , then a is thrown.

The result is determined as follows:
If the field is of type , then the result is 0L.
If the field is of type , then the result is the value obtained by parsing the string value with strtoll.
If the field is of type , then the result is the long value.
If the field is of type , then the result is the floating-point value converted to a long.
If the field is of type , then a is thrown.

Docs.summary: Sets the number of columns in this window.

remarks.para: Sets the number of columns in this window.
This method must be called before any rows are added to the window, otherwise it will fail to set the number of columns if it differs from the current number of columns.

remarks.para:

Gets the start position of this cursor window.
The start position is the zero-based index of the first row that this window contains relative to the entire result set of the .

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
